title: Wilson's Tales of the Borders and of Scotland, Volume 18
author: Alexander Leighton
snippet: Her kind friend Nanny Nivison attended her in her lastillness, and the guidman of Barmoor paid every humane attention.

title: Wilson's Tales of the Borders and of Scotland, Volume 18
author: Alexander Leighton
snippet: Theguidman would not credit such allegations; but the old women persistedin their averment, and even offered to give the guidman of Barmooroccular demonstration of the guilt of the twa _saunts_, as they calledthem.

title: Wilson's Tales of the Borders and of Scotland, Volume 18
author: Alexander Leighton
snippet: But the M'Dermots were the aversion ofeverybody, and seldom visited even by the guidman of Barmoor, on whosefarm, or rather on the debatable skirts of it, they had sat down, almostin spite of his teeth.
